byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin contributed reporting from Washington.

abstract: Wisconsin Gov Scott Walker has undergone dramatic rightward shift on social issues as he pursues Republican presidential nomination, taking a more conservative stance on abortion in particular; Walker's sponsorship of 'personhood' amendment in his state is in marked contrast to deference he paid to women's choice while fighting recall election in 2014.
lead_paragraph: Wisconsin’s governor, a Republican, has made shifts in how he talks about abortion and same-sex marriage since his re-election victory over a well-funded Democrat.

headline.main: In Pre-Primary Pivot to Right, Walker Shifts Tone on Abortion
headline.print_headline: In Pre-Primary Pivot to Right, Walker Shifts Tone on Abortion

snippet: Wisconsin’s governor, a Republican, has made shifts in how he talks about abortion and same-sex marriage since his re-election victory over a well-funded Democrat.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
